pageContext.claim: “The guy with the tape recorder who got paid money. I mean, he got paid a tremendous amount of money. I didn’t know the FBI had the right to pay somebody like that. I mean that’s. He got paid more than anybody at the FBI gets paid by a lot. ... I mean I heard reports from $500,000 to $2 million.”
pageContext.analysis: FBI informant Stefan Halper obtained four contracts with the Defense Department’s Office of Net Assessment totalling $1.058 million between 2012 and 2016. This was for work that did not involve the FBI. It is unknown how much money, if any, he received from the FBI.
